entry.content:
🍁 When the cold tip its nose, I like to make comforting soup recipes.

🍲 This one might surprise you since it is actually a vegetable version 🌱 of a soup that you all know very well: the chicken noodle soup! 🙂

I have been doing it for 2 years now and it has become a staple for the cold seasons!

for 4 portions

Ingredients

  • 2 tablespoon of olive oil
  • 1/2 yellow onion
  • 1 cup of diced carrot
  • 1 cup diced celery
  • 1 1/2 teaspoon of poultry spices
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 can of chickpeas
  • 2 cups of rotini
  • 4 cups of vegetable broth
  • salt and pepper

Preparation

  1. In a medium pot, add water, salt and bring to a boil. When the water is ready, cook the Al dente rotini in it. drain and rinse the pasta in cold water to stop cooking. Be careful not to overcook them since they will end up cooking in the broth.
  2. In a large pot over medium heat, add the oil and sweat the onions.
  3. Add the carrots, celery and sauté for a few minutes.
  4. Add the vegetable broth, the spices, the chickpeas and let simmer simmer so that everything takes on flavor.
  5. In a soup bowl, pour 1/4 of the cooked pasta and 1/4 of the broth and serve.

Note: I only mix my pasta with the broth once it has cooled because I don't want to have soft pasta.

entry.title: End of summer quinoa salad
entry.summary: 🥗 If you don't think of yourself as someone who loves salads, this one will instantly change your mind. 😛 Actually, this is one of the best salad I've eaten. It is rich and full of texture …
entry.content:
🥗 If you don't think of yourself as someone who loves salads, this one will instantly change your mind. 😛 Actually, this is one of the best salad I've eaten. It is rich and full of texture. A real delight that I could eat for several days in a row.

It was so good that I considered eating the second portion which was for my lunch the next day. 😛

  • 2 portions*

Ingredients

  • 1 clove of garlic
  • 2 teaspoon of olive oil
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 cup of quinoa
  • 2 cups of water
  • 1 large handful of small green beans
  • 5 radishes
  • 1/2 teaspoon of chili flakes
  • 2 cups of salad of your choice
  • 1/4 cup of parsley
  • 1/4 cup of sliced ​​almonds
  • 3 tablespoons of dijon mustard
  • 3 tablespoons of lemon juice
  • 2 tablespoons of maple syrup
  • 2/3 of a VegNature faux-cheese

Preparation

  1. Minced the garlic clove and divided in half.
  2. In a pot or in a rice cooker, put 1 teaspoon of olive oil, 1/2 of the garlic clove, a little salt, the quinoa and the water. Mix and cook until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender. Let the quinoa cool.
  3. This part of the recipe can be made in advance since the quinoa must be cooled or lukewarm.
  4. Remove the stems from the beans and cut them in half. Thinly slice the radishes and immerse them in a bowl of water. Finely chop the parsley. Then make fauxmage rings.
  5. In a skillet over medium heat, roast the flaked almonds. Then transferred them to a dish.
  6. In the same pan, over medium heat, put 1 teaspoon of olive oil, the other 1/2 of the garlic clove, the chilli flakes, the small beans and cook until until let the beans soften a little and remove from the heat. Salt and pepper.
  7. Assemble the salad by putting half of the quinoa at the bottom of the plate, the salad, the beans, the almonds. Add the fauxmage breaking the slices into pieces. Pour in the vinaigrette and finish with the parsley.

Enjoy your meal!

entry.content:
🍋Are you more of a lemon or lime person?

Lemon has always been my favorite citrus. I'm all about that lemonade or lemon pie. 😋 With time, I learned to also love lime in soups, guacamole and limeade.

Since I had a lot of it in my fridge this summer, I got inspired by science et fourchette deluxe basil lemonade recipe, and I made my own limeade with mint and what I had in my pantry.

For 1L of limeade

Ingredients

  • Zest of 2-3 limes
  • 1 cup of lime juice
  • 1/2 cup of maple syrup
  • 3 cups of water
  • 5-6 mint leaves, cut into a chiffonade
  • 1 tablespoon of chia seed

Preparation

  1. In a pitcher put all the ingredients and mix everything well.
  2. Let the chia seeds sit for 15 minutes to gel and serve.

NOTE: it is possible to do as a science et fourchette and put everything in a blender to have a homogeneous mixture. 🙂

When I received my 🍈 SecondLife 🥒 basket and it contained a cantaloupe …
entry.content:
👩🏼‍🍳 My greatest wish during the summer, in the kitchen, is to use oven cooking as little as possible. Often, I still do quite well! 🙂

When I received my 🍈 SecondLife 🥒 basket and it contained a cantaloupe and a cucumber I thought to myself that it would be interesting to make a refreshing summer salad and of course without baking in the oven.

In addition, what better than to add the grilled Halloounie tofu to to make a nutritious, delicious and flavorful meal?

for 4 portions

Ingredients

  • 1 grilled Halloounie tofu (prepared in advance)
  • 2 tablespoons of olive oil
  • 1 cup of quinoa
  • 2 cups of water
  • 1 small cantaloupe
  • 1 cucumber from the garden
  • 5-7 basil leaves
  • 5-7 mint leaves
  • 3/8 cup of olive oil flavored with shallot *
  • 1/8 cup of balsamic vinegar flavored with pear and blackberry *
  • Salt and pepper
  • 1-2 green onions

Preparation

  1. Prepare the grilled Halloonie tofu in advance, without grilling it.
  2. In a rice cooker, put the olive oil, the quinoa and the water and let cook and temper.
  3. While the quinoa is cooking, remove the peel from the cantaloupe using a peeler. Cut the cantaloupe in half and remove the seeds. Finally, cut the cantaloupe into thin wedges and put them in a large bowl.
  4. Cut the cucumber lengthwise, then cut crosswise to obtain half moons. Put everything in the same bowl as the cantaloupe.
  5. Cut the basil and mint into a chiffonade. And mix everything with cantaloupe and cucumber.
  6. Cut the green onions into thin rings and set aside.
  7. In a small container, combine olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper to make a vinaigrette.
  8. Pour half the vinaigrette over the cucumber and cantaloupe salad and mix. Pour the other half into the tempered quinoa and mix.
  9. Grill the Halloonie tofu and cut it into strips.
  10. On a plate, place 1/4 of the quinoa preparation, on top of it place 1/4 of the cantaloupe and cucumber salad, 1/4 of Halloonie tofu. Sprinkle the dish with green onions then serve.

** An unflavored olive oil or balsamic vinegar can do the job just as well. It is even possible to add more green onion in the recipe to put it directly in the vinaigrette. Also, a balsamic vinegar flavored with another fruit such as strawberry can work very well.

entry.title: Easy roasted eggplant recipe
entry.summary: It's eggplant season! 🍆 I rarely cook eggplant, I don't remember having eaten eggplant with my parents. It's a vegetable that I don't think is very popular. As I received this vegetable in my SecondLife basket …
entry.content:
It's eggplant season! 🍆 I rarely cook eggplant, I don't remember having eaten eggplant with my parents. It's a vegetable that I don't think is very popular. As I received this vegetable in my SecondLife basket, I had to brainstorm and find a recipe that was going to please me.

I finally decided to roast the eggplants in the oven and eat them in a buddha bowl. 🥗 I liked it so much that I ate it all week long!

For 4 portions

Ingredients

  • 1 large eggplant
  • 2 tablespoon of salt
  • 2 tablespoon of soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon of maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon of lemon juice
  • 2 tablespoon of olive oil
  • 2 tablespoon of nutritional yeast (nooch)

Preparation

  1. Cut the eggplant into 1/3 inch thick slices and place them side by side on a clean tea towel.
  2. Sprinkle salt on each side of the eggplant slices.
  3. Leave the eggplant to disgorged of its water for 15-30 minutes.
  4. Meanwhile in a large bowl put the soy sauce, maple syrup, lemon juice, olive oil and nutritional yeast and mix everything together.
  5. After 15-30 minutes, wipe off the water and some of the salt from the eggplant with a clean tea towel.
  6. Preheat the oven to 350 °F.
  7. Cut the eggplant slices into strips. (optional)
  8. Line a baking sheet with a silicone sheet or parchment paper.
  9. Place the eggplant strips on the baking sheet.
  10. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the eggplant is roasted.

entry.title: The best orchard salsa
entry.summary: Not being a tomato fan, salsas never appealed to me. But for the past few years, I can't get enough of eating this green apple salsa. It often serves me as a late afternoon snack …
entry.content:
Not being a tomato fan, salsas never appealed to me. But for the past few years, I can't get enough of eating this green apple salsa. It often serves me as a late afternoon snack or appetizer when I people come over. It also happens that I prepare it to accompany tacos. It has become a staple in my kitchen!

This recipe is inspired by a recipe I tasted during a Tupperware party organized by my friend Stéphanie. Since the recipe was not vegan I adapted this one to suit my diet, my tastes, but especially what I have in my pantry.

Ingredients

  • 3 green apples
  • 1/2 red pepper
  • 1-2 French shallots
  • 1 jalapeno pepper (quantity to taste)
  • 1 lime
  • 1 tablespoon of maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon of chipotle pepper powder

Preparation

  1. Remove the peel from the shallots.
  2. Cut the apples and peppers into large wedges.
  3. In a food processor, finely chopped the French shallots and the jalapeno pepper.
  4. Add the apples and peppers in small quantities to the food processor to roughly chop them.
  5. Add the lime juice, the tablespoon of maple syrup and the chipotle pepper powder.
  6. Mix everything in the food processor and serve.

entry.title: Easy plant-based chocolate chip cookie recipe
entry.summary: It's the perfect recipe for those times when you don't feel like cooking, but would love to have dessert. This recipe is simple, takes little time to cook and there is minimal dishes to do …
entry.content:
It's the perfect recipe for those times when you don't feel like cooking, but would love to have dessert. This recipe is simple, takes little time to cook and there is minimal dishes to do.

For 12 cookies

Ingredients

  • 1/2 cup sugar
  • 1 teaspoon of molasse
  • 1/2 cup of plant-based margarine
  • 2 tablespoon of plant-based milk
  • 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
  • 1 cup of all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda
  • 1/4 teaspoon of salt
  • 1 cup of dark chocolate chip

Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350F.
  2. In a bowl add the molasses and sugar together. Mix together with a fork until combined. If you happen to have a stand mixer, this step can be done with it.
  3. Add the margarine, milk and vanilla, and beat with a stand mixer or hand mixer, until the mixture becomes creamy.
  4. Add the flour, baking soda, salt and mix until well combined.
  5. Using a spatula, fold the chocolate chips into the mixture.
  6. Line a baking sheet with a silicone sheet or parchment paper.
  7. Using an ice cream scoop, form cookie dough balls directly on the baking sheet. Do not put more than 6 cookies per tray, the cookies tend to spread.
  8. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes.

entry.title: Quick vegan french toast recipe
entry.summary: Have you ever think about what you could do with some dry out bread from the day before? Well I did, and I creater a recipe to reduce waste! Instead of composting your dry bread …
entry.content:
Have you ever think about what you could do with some dry out bread from the day before? Well I did, and I creater a recipe to reduce waste! Instead of composting your dry bread, I invite you to make this vegan french toast recipe.😉

4 portions

Ingredients

  • 1 cup plant-based milk
  • 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 pinch of salt
  • 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon of plant-based margarine
  • 8 bread slices of about 1/2 inch think
  • 1 1/2 cup of sliced strawberries
  • maple sirup
  • vanilla plant-based yogourt
  • 1/4 cup sliced almonds

Instructions

  1. In a bowl, mix the milk, cinnamon, salt and vanilla extract.
  2. Place the bread slices in the mixture and let them soak in. Let the excess drain.
  3. In a frying pan, heat 1/4 tablespoon of margarine over medium heat.
  4. Place the slices of bread in the pan and cook them for about 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Repeat step 3 and 4 with the other slices.
  5. When ready to serve, garnish the French toast with strawberries, maple syrup, yogourt, and sliced almonds.

entry.content:
Have you ever tried to make homemade sourdough? 🍞

Two weeks ago, I started experimenting with sourdough. And I'm quite proud of the result. I've been trying to make my own sourdough for a long time. With social distancing, I finally managed to find a spot on my agenda for this experience.

What is sourdough? 🤓

It is the result of fermentation between flour, water and air. It allows you to replace instant yeast bought in grocery stores to make your bread or other recipe requiring a leavening agent.

Here's the recipe...

You'll need:

  • a transparent container + lid
  • a scale
  • a marker such as an elastic or adhesive tape

Ingredients:

  • 100g lukewarm water (not hot, lukewarm)
  • 50g whole flour
  • 50g of unbleached white flour

Day 1 (base creation):

  • In your container, mix all the ingredients together.
  • Thoroughly scrape the edges of the container to be able to measure the progress of the sourdough and put the marker at the height of the mixture.
  • Let everything sit for 24 hours at room temperature.

Day 2 (feed sourdough starter):

Look at the edges of your container for sourdough fermentation signs: Did it grow and/or left marks on the edges of your container? It can go up and down. Another sign that your sourdough has fermented is the formation of air bubbles.

No fermentation signs? Leave it for another day.

Has it grown? Then in another container, put 25g of sourdough starter that you prepared the day before and add the same ingredients as on day 1 (water, flour). Mix everything and then wait another 24 hours. Repeat the same steps from day 2 until the sourdough starter is ready.

How do you know if your sourdough is ready?

Normally, the it is ready in 7 days or more. To be sure, you simply have to do the floating test: In a bowl of lukewarm water place a spoon of sourdough. It floats? So it's ready! Otherwise, repeat the steps from day 2.

If you try to make your own sourdough starter, leave me a comment to tell me about your experience! 😊

My sourdough starter is ready, what should I do?

  • You can now use it to make bread or other dishes that requires a leavening agent.
  • You don't want to feed it every day? You just have to feed it and put it in the fridge, it can wait 7 days before being re-fed.
  • What to do with the rest of my unnecessary leaven? You can use it in a pancake, crêpe or other mixtures. Only your imagination has limits! 😊

Other notes

  • Mix your sourdough with water before adding the flour, so you make sure your sourdough is well incorporated.
  • The warmer the room temperature, the faster the sourdough starter will rise.
  • Puting too hot water or leave your sourdough at too high temperature (eg: oven) will kill it.
  • Conversely, a cold temperature will slow down the fermentation.
  • if there is a dark liquid on top of your sourdough: this is a sign that you don't feed your sourdough frequently/quickly enough. You just have to empty the liquid and continue to feed it.
  • Make sure that there is no mold. If that's the case, then throw your sourdough starter and start again.
